thread.title: Local roundup: Black Wolves acquire forward, pick from Vancouver
thread.title_full: Local roundup: Black Wolves acquire forward, pick from Vancouver

author: The Bulletin
title: Local roundup: Black Wolves acquire forward, pick from Vancouver
text: MOHEGAN — The New England Black Wolves acquired forward Tyler Digby and a second round pick in the 2017 National Lacrosse League Entry Draft from the Vancouver Stealth on Sunday, in exchange for forward Garrett Billings. Digby, a two-year veteran, posted career-highs in 2015 with 38 goals, 36 assists and 74 points. Billings played in eight games for the Black Wolves after being acquired from Toronto on March 31st, totaling five goals and 31 assists for 36 points. The Black Wolves open the 2016 season in Vancouver on Jan. 9. WOMEN’S SOCCER UConn 2 SMU 1 STORRS — Samantha McGuire and Brianna Butler scored in the first half and the No. 11 Huskies (16-2, 8-1) clinched the American Athletic Conference regular season title. UConn will play East Carolina in the AAC Tournament on Nov. 3 in Dallas. Time is to be determined. WOMEN’S FIELD HOCKEY UConn 4 Princeton 1 STORRS — Roisin Upton scored twice as part of a four-goal second half to keep the No. 2 Huskies (17-0) undefeated on the season. WOMEN’S ICE HOCKEY UConn 4 Penn St. 3 UNIVERSITY PARK, Pa. — The Huskies (3-1-2) scored three unanswered goals in the third period, capped by Marisa Maccario’s game-winner, to rally past the Nittany Lions. WOMEN’S VOLLEYBALL UConn 3 Houston 0 STORRS — Rebecca Rivera dished out 20 assists to lead the Huskies (11-10, 5-5 AAC) to their fourth straight win, 25-21, 25-19, 27-25. FROM SATURDAY St. Thomas More 18 Tabor 0 MONTVILLE — Former Ledyard player Leo Clinton ran for 111 yards and a touchdown on 14 carries to lead the Chancellors to victory. Former Montville quarterback Tyler Quidgeon added a safety on defense. Gilberto Torres had 17 carries for 137 yards and a touchdown for St. Thomas More (2-3). BOYS CROSS-COUNTRY Griffins split WASHINGTON — Charles Sheehan (20:15) finished a team-best fifth to help the Pomfret defeat Cheshire Academy, 21-37, but it was not enough to defeat host Gunnery School, 23-32. GIRLS CROSS-COUNTRY Griffins win 2 WASHINGTON — Sofia Melian-Morse (21:29) won to help Pomfret earn a pair of victories, 18-45 over host Gunnery School and 19-42 over Cheshire Academy but the Griffins fell to Westover, 23-37. By The Bulletin
